com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server
Class SmtpServer

java.lang.Object
  com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server.SmtpServer

public class SmtpServer
extends Object

Responsible for sending messages to a list of addresses. Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an Internet standard for electronic mail (e-mail) transmission across Internet Protocol (IP) networks. SMTP was first defined in RFC 821 (STD 10), and last updated by RFC 5321 (2008) which describes extended SMTP (ESMTP), the protocol in widespread use today.

While electronic mail server software uses SMTP to send and receive mail messages, user-level client mail applications typically only use SMTP for sending messages to a mail server for relaying. For receiving messages, client applications usually use either the Post Office Protocol (POP) or the Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) to access their mail box accounts on a mail server.

Version:
1.00 2009-05-12 Initial submission., 1.10 2009-05-31 Modified connect() to deal with changes to ConnectionInfo. Added message breaking features. Added debug control variable in constructor. "ok" variable support in case connection was intentionally closed.
Author:
rhaq

Constructor Detail

SmtpServer

public SmtpServer(ConnectionInfo info,
                  boolean debug)
           throws MessagingException
Creates a SMTP server using the connection information specified and sets up the channels required to send data to destinations.

Parameters:
info - The server connection information.
debug - Should debug information be shown on the console.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem connecting to the remote service.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws MessagingException
Closes the connection to the host as well as dereferencing pointers. Stops trying to connect to the host.

Throws:
MessagingException - If there are any problems ending the connection.

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(String subject,
                        String body,
                        Address[] destinations)
                 throws MessagingException
Sends a message with the specified subject and body to the destinations specified. If the message needs to be broken, then that is done and each sub-message is sent one after the other.

Parameters:
subject - The subject of the message to be sent.
body - The actual content of the message to be sent.
destinations - The email addresses to send the message to.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem obtaining a channel to send the required data to the remote service.
